meanings.definition: Showing deep unhappiness of thought; contemplative and troubled.
meanings.sent1: The broodiest cat in the neighborhood always sits alone, lost in sad thoughts.
meanings.sent2: She had the broodiest expression on her face, making everyone wonder what troubled her.
meanings.sent3: The broodiest cloud in the sky seemed to be pondering its next move.
meanings.sent4: His broodiest mood was like a dark storm brewing inside him, ready to burst.
meanings.sent5: The broodiest music he listened to matched his melancholic state perfectly.

meanings.definition: Having or showing a sullen or gloomy disposition.
meanings.sent1: The broodiest child in the class always sat in the corner, frowning at everyone.
meanings.sent2: Her broodiest look made it clear she was not in the mood for jokes.
meanings.sent3: The broodiest teddy bear in the shop had a perpetual scowl on its face.
meanings.sent4: The broodiest sky he had ever seen seemed to reflect his own gloomy mood.
meanings.sent5: The broodiest painting in the gallery captured a sense of deep sadness.

meanings.definition: Characterized by deep thought or contemplation.
meanings.sent1: The broodiest student in the class always had his head buried in books.
meanings.sent2: Her broodiest moments were when she sat by the window, lost in thought.
meanings.sent3: The broodiest owl in the tree seemed to be pondering the mysteries of the night.
meanings.sent4: The broodiest river flowed slowly, as if lost in contemplation of its path.
meanings.sent5: The broodiest silence filled the room, making everyone pause and reflect.
